algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) to identify connected component and border cells
problem_summary_simple: Color the border of a connected component in a grid with a new color.
problem_summary_technical: Uses BFS to find the connected component and identify cells adjacent to different colors or grid boundaries.
key_insights: A Breadth-First Search (BFS) is suitable for exploring the connected component.
A cell is part of the border if it's on the grid boundary or adjacent to a cell of a different color.
Keep track of visited cells to avoid redundant processing and infinite loops.
